== Kubuntu 12.04 LTS to 12.10 Upgrade ==

You will need to:
* set release upgrades to be for normal releases instead of LTS releases
* run the release upgrade tool
* reboot

=== Upgrade to Kubuntu 12.10 ===

1) Run Muon Software Centre<<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:quantal-upgrade0.png]]</nowiki>

----

2) Select '''Settings''' -> '''Configure Software Sources'''<<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:quantal-upgrade1.png]]</nowiki>

----

3) Under '''Updates''' set '''Release upgrade''' to '''normal''' and click Close<<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:quantal-upgrade2.png]]</nowiki>

----

4) Start Muon Update Manager, you will be notified for updates.<<BR>>
<nowiki>[[File:quantal-upgrade-muon.png]]</nowiki>

or<<BR>>
4) You will be prompted for an upgrade, click the gear icon in the systray. <<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:quantal-upgrade-notify.png]]</nowiki>

----

5) Enter your password<<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:quantal-upgrade-password.png]]</nowiki>

----
6) The upgrade tool will start <<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:quantal-upgrade5.png]]</nowiki>

----

7) It will confirm if you want to start the upgrade<<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:quantal-upgrade6.png]]</nowiki>

----

8) It will download and install the new release, have some coffee<<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:quantal-upgrade7.png]]</nowiki>

----

9) It may ask about conf file changes, click '''Replace''' to upgrade<<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:quantal-upgrade8.png]]</nowiki>

----

10) It will ask to confirm removing obsolete packages, click '''Remove'''. <<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:quantal-upgrade9.png]]</nowiki>

----

11) The last step of the entire process is to go ahead and reboot your machine. <<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:quantal-upgrade10.png]]</nowiki>

== Welcome to Kubuntu 12.10 ==
If everything went smoothly after the upgrade and the reboot, your desktop should look like the following: <<BR>>

<nowiki>[[File:quantal-upgrade11-wee.png]]</nowiki>
